name: Radiation-Induced Esophagitis
chief_complaint: Painful swallowing and chest discomfort after radiation therapy
physical_findings: Mild dehydration due to reduced fluid intake
treatment: Proton pump inhibitors for acid suppression
prognosis: Generally resolves within 2-4 weeks after completing radiation therapy, though severe cases may require temporary feeding tube placement
description: Inflammation of the esophageal lining caused by radiation therapy, typically occurring 2-3 weeks into treatment for thoracic or head/neck cancers. The condition results from direct damage to the rapidly dividing mucosal cells.
